result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R. Newton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: DNA Order & Acknowledgment / DNA Proof of Submission
of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue/copy delivered to defendant at LCSD on 5/16/22.
JU, NEJ, NOC & NOT delivered to defendant at LCSD on 5/16/22.

03:11 PM in Room 301. 21CF151, 21CF134 and 22CF58. Defendant Matthew R. Newton in court with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach.  Defendant Matthew R. Newton in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew R. Newton appeared by video means with Attorney. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. can hear, understands and consents to proceed by Zoom. State recites agreement. Joint recommendation. 22CF58 - Def. to plead to Ct. 1, 2 and 3 and 5. Ct. 4 to be DRI.  21CF134 Ct. 1 and 2 to be DRI.  21CF151  - Ct. 1, 2 and 3 to be DRI. Recommendation - 22CF58 - Ct. 1  withhold sentence, 4 years probation, concurrent, costs wth DNA surcharge and sample, alcohol and other drug treatment as deemed necessary by agent, maintain abs. sobriety, maintain fulltime employment, counseling and assessments as deemed necessary.   Ct. 2 - 1 year jail, imp.stayed, consecutive, 4 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, comply with conditions as set forth 1. Ct. 3  - imp/stayed 6 years prison, (3 ic, 3 es), consecutive, 4 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, comply with conditions in Ct. 1.  Ct. 5 - 6 months jail, consecutive, costs with DNA surcharge. Waiver of P.H. and arraignment already held in 22CF58. Attny Fehrenbach in agreement. Def. agrees with terms. Plea questionnaire reviewed. 
22CF58 - Ct. 1 - Poss of Meth, repeater, guilty.  Ct. 2 - bail jumping, repeater, guilty.   Ct. 3- bail jumping, repeater, guilty.  Ct. 5 - resist/obstruct, repeater,  guilty. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Court grants State's motion to DRI Ct. 4 in 22CF58; Cts. 1, 2 and 3 in 21CF151 and Cts. 1 and 2 in 21CF134. Attny Fehrenbach is satisfied. The Court finds that Def. understands and that pleas were freely and voluntarily given. Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1, Ct. 2, Ct 3 and Ct. 5 in 22CF58. Sentencing argument by State.  Sentencing argument by Attny Fehrenbach. Def. makes statement. Court questions Def. Remarks by the Court. 
The Court will abide by agreement, orders 
22CF58 - Ct. 1  withhold sentence, 4 years probation, costs wth DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, continue drug treatment and counseling as recommended by agent, participate in any counseling as deemed beneficial by agent, maintain absolute sobriety, maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.
Ct. 2 - imposed/stayed 1 year jail, Huber, consecutive to Ct. 1, 4 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, comply with conditions as set forth in Count 1. 
Ct. 3  - imp/stayed 6 years prison (3 yrs initial confinement, 3 yrs ext. sup), consecutive to Cts 1 and 2, 4 years probation, costs only with DNA surcharge, comply with same conditions.  
Ct. 5 - 6 months jail, Huber, consecutive to other counts, costs only with DNA surcharge. 
Credit: 79 days on 22CF58.
Costs to be paid during probation on probation counts. Costs on Ct. 5 to be converted to civil judgment. Firearm/voting rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Eligible for substance abuse and challenge incarceration programs.  Post conviction rights.

records.addlTxt: Court calls 22CF58, 21CF134, 21CF151 @ 01:14 PM Defendant Matthew R. Newton in court with attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer.  Defendant Matthew R. Newton in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew R. Newton appeared by video means with Attorney. Atty Restemayer advise court this is going to be a waive of p.h.   Def. agrees to waive p.h.  Court goes over waiver of preliminary examination form with def.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Information filed. Atty Restemary has copy of Information, waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty plea. All 3 case set for plea & sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Newton appeared by video means with Attorney. 21CF134 & 21CF151 will continue to track, 22CF58 Atty Restemayer has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights, bond set, timely p.h. Set for p.h. and bail/bond modification. Atty Restemayer need to complete written bail/bond modification.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

Court calls  22CF58, 21CF134 & 21CF151 @ 01:20 PM. Defendant Matthew R. Newton in court, in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew R. Newton appeared by video means. ROW on 21CF134/21CF151 & 22CF58  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to reach out to P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation to cover all 3 files, with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances  & No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Def. heard on bond. Court orders $10,000 cash bond with conditions to cover all 3 files. Court vacate warrants.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
